questions.question_text: Which two impacts of adding the IP event dampening feature to a network design are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
B. It improves overall network stability
E. It reduces the utilization of system processing resources

comments.content:
Configuring the IP Event Dampening feature improves convergence
times and stability throughout the network by isolating failures so that disturbances are not propagated. This,
in turn, reduces the utilization of system processing resources by other devices in the network and improves
overall network stability

Answer BE

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
correct
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_pi/configuration/15-s/iri-15-s-book/iri-ip-event-damp.pdf

choices.C: It speeds up link failure detection
choices.A: It switches traffic immediately after a link failure
choices.E: It reduces the utilization of system processing resources

discussion.content:
Refer markmark1983 link, step 4 & 5 should be inverted as below corrected answer.
1) Develop cloud strategy and ensure alignment with business requirements.
2) Identify the right applications and portfolio for cloud migration and cloud viability.
3) Secure the cloud by setting up a secure cloud environment based on the workload requirements.
4) Maintain data integrity and operatoinal continuity.
5) Adopt end-to-end approach and transition workloads to the cloud environment.
6) Monitor and manage cloud-based systems, including customer services.
https://www.ibm.com/cloud/blog/6-key-elements-for-a-successful-cloud-migration

1. Develop a strategy
2. Identify the right applications
3. Secure the right cloud provider
4. Maintain data integrity and operational continuity
5. Adopt an end-to-end approach
6. Execute your cloud migration

https://www.ibm.com/think/insights/6-key-elements-for-a-successful-cloud-migration

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

An enterprise wants to migrate an on-premises network to a cloud network, and the design team is finalizing the overall migration process. Drag and drop the options from the left into the correct order on the right.

//IMG//

A service provider recently migrated to an SD-WAN solution for delivering WAN connections to its customers. One of the main challenges with the SD-WAN deployment is that branch site volume increases every year, which causes management complexity. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Service lifecycle

Selected Answer: D
Many MSPs will handle the LCM process for customers, this includes upgrading the CPE device when the customer requests it, usually carrying a small upgrade fee and then a small increase in MRR for the bigger device.

comments.content: No for B. SD-WAN allready includes orchestration 'layer' to provision branch devices. Voting for D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/enterprise-networks/what-is-network-orchestration.html#~q-a

Selected Answer: D
service midel is best i think - nothing to do with orchestration!!

choices.A: Set up a dedicated team to monitor and provision new customers
choices.C: Implement a scalable network management system to manage all sites
choices.B: Build a service orchestration platform on top of the network controller
choices.D: Adopt a well-structured SD-WAN service management lifecycle model

choices.A: zone-based firewall on the Layer 3 device

discussion.content:
C.
D can do 'control traffic within a subnet', but cannot do DPI.
It cannot be B as the traffic within subnets does not traverse routed FW
answer should be transparant FW

Selected Answer: C
requirement is to control traffic WITHIN a subnet - not between subnets - transparent FW

Selected Answer: A
A zone-based firewall operates on Layer 3 and can control traffic between subnets. It allows administrators to group interfaces into different zones and apply policies to regulate the traffic between the zones

Selected Answer: C
C is good.

questions.question_text: Company XYZ is revisiting the security design for their data center because they now have a requirement to control traffic within a subnet and implement deep packet inspection. Which technology meets the updated requirements and can be incorporated into the design?

The Layer 3 control plane is the intelligence over the network that steers traffic toward its intended destination. Which two techniques can be used in service provider-style networks to offer a more dynamic, flexible, controlled, and secure control plane design? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Common mechanisms to protect control plane include iACLs, routing protection, and control plane policing (CoPP). Common mechanisms to protect Data plane include infrastructure ACLs (iACLs), QoS toolset, remotely triggered black hole (RTBH), and Unicast Reverse Path Forwarding (uRPF).

Selected Answer: AB
A&B. RBHT is obvious. QPPB enables routers to deprioritize or drop malicious traffic that classified by BGP attributes (such as prefixes, as-paths, or communities). Prefix list alone does not achieve security.

Selected Answer: あイ
I think correct ans are A and B.
The Cisco Press CCDE text contains the following statement.


 typical static filtering mechanisms, such as using ACLs or prefix lists.

Selected Answer: BC
RTBH+Prefix-list

Selected Answer: BC
I ruled out A

Where is Q214-216? 
I purchased another dump that has 267 questions. Seems missing some questions here.

comments.content:
I'm wrong about A, it's not good for "steers traffic toward its intended destination".
I guess RTBH and PLs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
I think it's A and B. 
Good link with example on how both used: https://blog.pierky.com/gns3-labs-bgp-triggered-rate-limiting-and-less-than-best-effort-lbe-with-qppb/
how does prefix-list secure control plane dsign?

comments.content:
Prefix-list is used to protect your server which is the destination.
e.g.
ip community-list standard blackhole permit 65535:666
route-map blackhole-in permit 20
 match community blackhole
 match ip address (prefix-list)
 set ip next-hop 192.0.2.1
Read on RTBH then you will understand. They work hand in hand
